body.name: Epson® Workforce® Pro WF-3820 Wireless Color Inkjet All-in-One Printer, Black Large
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Greener Sales and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 8 hrs 13 mins
features: Built for speed — PrecisionCore Heat-Free Technology delivers fast, high-volume printing with 21 (black)/11 (color) ISO ppm () and fast first-page-out.
High-precision printing — accurate dot placement and DURABrite Ultra instant-dry pigment inks for professional-quality prints.
High-volume reliability for heavy workloads — innovative heat-free technology designed for reliability and reduced downtime.
Designed for productivity — auto 2-sided printing and 1-sided, 35-page ADF streamline workflow.
Maximize efficiency — with large, 250-sheet paper capacity.
Easy to use — 2.7" color touchscreen for quick navigation and control, plus all-new Epson Smart Panel App (1) for enhanced connectivity and productivity from your mobile device.
Convenient, wireless setup — using a smartphone or mobile device (2) with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE); also includes built-in wireless, Wi-Fi Direct (3) and Ethernet networking.
Seamless scanning — Epson ScanSmart supports easy scanning and editing with a user-friendly interface.
Comprehensive security features — including secure wireless and Secure Data Erase.
body.description: Bring a new level of productivity to your business with the ultra efficient WorkForce Pro WF-3820 all-in-one printer. Designed for high-volume print environments, the WF-3820 delivers precise, professional-quality prints at fast speeds up to 21 (black)/11 (color) ISO ppm ( ) using vibrant DURABrite Ultra instant-dry pigment inks. A breakthrough in business printing, the WF-3820 features Epson’s innovative PrecisionCore Heat-Free Technology designed for enhanced reliability with minimal downtime. Built with convenience in mind, the WF-3820 offers a variety of user-friendly features to support easy, streamlined printing for small workgroups, including auto 2-sided printing, a large, 250-sheet paper capacity, built-in wireless and a 2.7" color touchscreen for quick navigation and control. This product uses only genuine Epson-brand cartridges. Other brands of ink cartridges and ink supplies are not compatible and, even if described as compatible, may not function properly. Black and color print speeds are measured in accordance with ISO/IEC 24734. Actual print times will vary based on factors including system configuration, software, and page complexity. For more information, visit our official site.1. Requires Epson Smart Panel app download and a compatible smart device. Data usage fees may apply. For more information, please visit our official site.2. Most features require an Internet connection to the printer, as well as an Internet- and/or email-enabled device. For a list of Epson Connect enabled printers and compatible devices and apps, visit our official site. 3. Wi-Fi CERTIFIED; level of performance subject to the range of the router being used. Wi-Fi Direct may require printer software.4. Based on comparing manufacturers’ reported TEC values of the best-selling, similarly featured color laser printers priced about similarly or less with print speeds of 40 ppm or less as of February 2020.5. For convenient and reasonable recycling options, visit our official site.6. SmartWay is an innovative partnership of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Epson over many years. Print quality is very good. Easy to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Yes, this is worth buying.
reviews.reviewText: One of the easiest printers to set up !FOLLOW all of the setup instructions and things will go as planned, it works at the end of setup process.The touch screen is great.Connecting to BOTH a wifi device and an phone/tablet are two separate processes, dont think they are one and the same.The Sleep function timer can be adjusted, set mine at 15 minutes, default was 1 minute.Yes, if the printer goes to sleep the user must wake it up. That is not an issue.Yes, when it sleeps and you want to airprint the user must re-establish its connection. Not an issue.The paper tray? Yes some say its a bit flimsy. It’s plastic and Epson has made it as light as possible, so that means dont try abusing the paper tray.When re-inserting the tray THE BLUE RELEASE butoon tab is paramount in getting the tray to go back in correctly.That did take a bit of time to workout since the instructions were not clear on how to reinsert the full try again. Just DONT ram in back in thinking its stuck, its not stuck, it needs the BLUE RELEASE button pressed again.All in all, yes I would buy this same printer again.The negative reviews are a mystery to me, the printer works, like it was designed to work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Absolute WORST PRINTER I've ever used. My first-and LAST-Epson. Recent firmware update - final nail
reviews.reviewText: Wow. What a horrific experience, and it's not even been a year. Where to even start other than to say AVOID THIS PRINTER AT ALL COSTS. Interestingly, it's dropped by about $50 from last year, but don't think you're getting a deal - if it works at all, it won't for long, and what does print either won't print correctly, or it will never stay connected to your PC. Multiple devices? LOL!The final straw was the firmware update - yep, will not recognize my ink cartridges (3rd photo). You can scroll through the reviews and see how many others this happened to. Seems like the only positive reviews were "review of fReE product." Honestly, I'm kind of relieved because now I can get rid of this PIECE OF CRAP. Please save yourself the aggravation - there are so many other choices. Epson deserves to go down in flames for selling this junk and their pathetic customer service.I already left a review of this rattly piece of plastic, below. Yes, the negative reviews are REAL. It was already awful, literally from the first print. One thing after another, and then a week ago I noticed that all my front-back printouts were not lining up (first 2 photos). Assuming that for some random reason now the duplex wasn't flipping straight (which was literally the reason I got a new printer), I tried feeding front & back manually. Nope, that is ALSO crooked. You have got to be kidding me - I haven't even used this printer all that much because of the constant aggravation!Original comments:If you're only using plain 8.5x11 paper, don't mind paying outrageous prices for Epson-only ink, and love crooked printouts when nothing is broken, then you'll probably be OK. If you would like to use any different paper sizes at all, and heaven forbid you use any specialty paper, prepare to be infuriated, repeatedly. I WISH I had been able to test it more before the return window closed. But this new printer should be better than my 10 year old Canon, shouldn't it? It should. But nope!So today, we're not going to allow A5 paper and every time you try to use it, we'll bring it into the cartridge, stop it there, and then tell you it's jammed! Want to use Tomoe River? No way. First, we'll do the above, then we'll just tell you there's no paper in the cartridge, even though you've made sure it's loaded correctly. Want to duplex print? Prepare to be amazed at the illogic of it - no, we can't just flip a paper for you, we must load 8 programs on your computer first, and then never print correctly whether you choose flip-on-short-edge or flip-on-long-edge!There are so many other options out there, SAVE YOURSELF THE HEADACHE OF THIS PIECE OF JUNK! My first - and LAST - Epson.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great printer overall. Some issues with driver install.
reviews.reviewText: This is my third Epson WorkForce printer, and overall, I am very satisfied with it from a functional perspective. I did have some frustration while installing the print/scan applications, as even on a fully updated Windows 10 device, the driver install would stop at around 20% and never complete. I was able to manually install the driver by unpacking the self-extracting installer, and running the Scan, Print, and Fax installers individually. Once completed, all functions work as expected. The addition of a driver CD seems superfluous given the number of machines that have gone diskless, and excluding it would save a little cost on the manufacturing side, as well as keeping more plastic our of our waste stream. Overall, a solid printer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My HP envy died and this Epson WorkForce Pro WF-3823
reviews.reviewText: Ease of use and it steps on the accelerator and gives me the speed I like with all clarity. They say wait for a spell for the ink to dry. No problems putting them on top of each sheet as it prints.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Super easy to set up and it prints great from either my phone or laptop. Quick and easy to install. So far so good!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy setup, no subscription!
reviews.reviewText: Time from unpacking to printing direct from my phone was about 20 minutes. Was very simple to set up and connect to my home network. Downloaded the print app for Android and had no problem immediately printing pdf's from my phone. Print quality is fine and the touch display is easy to navigate. I'm so relieved to finally get away from HP products, wish I had done so sooner!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: i like the printer and it does everything i need it to do , which for me is print and scan, i type up and stuff off the internet that i need to print . i like the design of the printer and it doesnt take up much room .the ink is kind of high but i think youll find it less expensive on amazon ,and if your like me its best to buy the higher capacity ink cartridges .and im very impressed with the the print job it does. i think epson is a well respected name in the printing business which made me pick this printer . it was easy to set up , i installed it directlly to my desk top but you can also install it with wifi . a good price for a nice printer.

No es inyectable y decía que lo era, los cartuchos no duran nada, los que vienen me duraron para 350 más o menos de impresiones, si salen d buena calidad pero los cartuchos son caros. Mala compra en mi opinión

Just set this printer up. Setup was extremely easy. I downloaded the Epson iPrint App and printed off my phone just like that. No issues whatsoever. Printer came with all of the ink cartridges needed. An excellent purchase indeed.
En la descripción dice que tiene bluetooth y la caja solo dice que tiene WiFi y oor el bluetooth hice la compra porque es por eso que la necesito asi.
Printer was easy to set up. Prints in seconds and quality is excellent.
Ink cartridges run out by counting the number of times you print. You can't print black and white if any of the color cartridges are out. This is the worst printer, and a total scam.
